intro: Melampyrum dalmaticum, commonly known as the Dalmatian touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually pink or reddish, with two lips, and bloom in the summer months. The species is characterized by its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves.
